reviews.title: A cultural tour of Toronto through its food
text: Jane Herman led me and my Australian friends through several of Toronto's downtown neighborhoods in a 4 hour food crawl that left us satisfied physically and intellectually. She described the history of the neighborhoods and the particular restaurants we visited (5 different ethnicities, all delicious). We sampled foods from the Middle East, Japan, China, Thailand and Ethiopia (and took home plenty for dinner and lunch the next day!) and ended with pastries right by Little Trinity Church. Jane picked us up with a driver so we never had to worry about getting anywhere or parking and we all had a fantastic time. I can't recommend this food crawl highly enough!

reviews.title: The PATH, Private Tour
text: Insightful, historical, and interesting. Jane met our group of 8 guys, in town for a bachelor party, on this private morning tour of Toronto highlights via the PATH. She was knowledgeable and had an fun, easy-going personality. I got exactly what I was looking for on this 90 min tour, culminating in a fresh-market brunch fit for kings; awesome! Highly recommend; ask for Jane.

reviews.title: Distillery District, On the Town
text: I recently took a Distillery District tour with On the Town Tours. When scheduling the tour, Jane was very helpful and flexible with our schedule as well as willing to tailor to our interests. Upon meeting Jane, she is very friendly and welcoming. The tour was very informative, and it was great to see some of the older buildings in the city, and learn some of the history behind the building of the city. Our tour consisted of my boyfriend and myself, which made it more personal. It was also nice to go at our own pace, and not be to rushed. Jane allowed for extra time at various sites to get pictures and check out a few smaller museums. Jane gave a great tour and was a wealth of knowledge on the area. The Distillery District itself is beautiful and definitely a great place to explore. If you're looking for a good tour I would highly recommend On the Town Tours.

reviews.title: Sunday in the City with Jane
text: Jane met us at our hotel...and we were  on our way to a wonderful tour.  She arranged a customized tour for us and showed us sights we would have never seen on our own.  The breadth of her knowledge of Toronto's history and architecture  made the City come alive for us.
If you want a great tour of Toronto, go to Jane.  You will not regret it!

reviews.title: In-depth tour of Toronto's best places to see.
text: Being interested in history and urban architecture I had a great time with this tour. Jane is a very competent, knowledgeable and passionate person. I especially enjoyed visiting the financial district, the St. Lawrence Market and getting recommendations on what to visit next on my trip.

reviews.title: Architecture of downtown Toronto
text: Fascinating walking tour with Jane on June 7th. I was really struck by the variety of buildings in Toronto when I visited recently to attend a convention so was delighted to find that On the Town offer short walking tours on just this topic, with the very knowledgeable Jane.  I learned lots about the history of the development of this beautiful city and about different architectural styles as exemplified by the many individual skyscrapers and other municipal buildings constructed here over the past hundred and fifty years.

reviews.title: Dr.binod sah ::::>Most amazing day in Toronto with" jane "
text: We went to see Toronto with jane on june 4 of 2016. İt was amazing day for us. She is perfect guide with her knowledge about Toronto city.she took us to most of the places and explained us every detail of that places.she is very friendly and smiling face, helpful with positive feeling.İ was with my wife and 18 month daughter.we spend 5 hour with her and she treat us as we are member of her family.she was very kindly to my daughter as she says my daughter was the youngest visitor with her ever. So i want to thanks a lot to jane very much.Hope to see her in turkey

reviews.title: A magnificent tour with personal attention
text: Our tour of "Old Town and the Distillery District" with Jane was illuminating and fun! As a historian, I've toured historic districts across the globe. The personal touch that Jane gave to our tour put her at the top of my list. When rain was expected, she emailed before and offered a change of day or to drive—that's the type of personal attention she gives her tour guests. We started at the historic St. Lawrence Market where we perused old photos of the city and she provided background information on Toronto's history. Stops included: the Gooderham Building (Flatiron building), warehouses by St. Lawrence, St. James Anglican Church, a former courthouse (now restaurant), Bank of Upper Canada, De LaSalle Institute, a post office, Corktown, Little Trinity Church, Enoch Turner Schoolhouse, and the brick streets and redeveloped buildings of the Distillery District. Jane was incredibly knowledgeable and I appreciated how she took our pulse, so to say, and would gear her talk to subjects that we found most interesting. A fount of knowledge, no question I asked went unanswered (and I ask a lot of questions). She is a consummate professional with an excellent understanding of architectural and social history. I hope to return to Toronto and take another one of Jane's tours.

reviews.title: Explore a lakeside part of Toronto
text: I had the most delightful walking tour of the Toronto Waterfront on July 22.  Jane guides with intelligence and enthusiasm for her subject.  She also conveys a pride and affection for her city.  I've lived in Toronto my whole life and yet I learned a great deal about the history of this important area and the people who shaped the development over time.  I can imagine enjoying this tour in all the seasons -- so lovely to explore a lakeside part of TO.
I would highly recommend Jane and would definitely do more tours with On The Town!

reviews.title: Toronto Waterfront Walking Tour
text: Jane took us on tour of Toronto Waterfront from George Brown campus in the east to HTO Park in the west.  She is very knowledgeable about history and architecture and very pleasant company.   I am a Toronto resident and I was interested to see all the changes in recent years and pleased to see how good the city looks from this perspective - as opposed to from the Gardiner Expressway in gridlock.  Ordinarily Janes Waterfront tour is a little longer (time and distance) and runs from west to east. However she easily accommodated our schedule and location to make the tour work for us.  Thank you Jane!

reviews.title: Wonderful stroll into the architecture and history of Toronto
text: Jane is a devoted expert in Toronto's architecture and the history related to the city's buildings. In fact, she manages to pass on her enthusiasm to her audience during the interesting walks she guides. My husband and I registered for two different walks, and one of them was for free! Actually, Jane is so much into her walks and the city that she not only had this one free tour through the newly revitalized Queens Quay but told us she would be also offering free tours during the oncoming Pan Am Games. Congratulations for your fine work, Jane, and do hope you keep on!

reviews.title: Extensive Knowledge and Great Delivery!
text: I thoroughly enjoyed my experience touring the city with Jane Herman and On the Town.  Jane has extensive knowledge of Toronto's history and architecture which she conveys with enthusiasm and clarity. Overall the tour was an incredibly illuminating experience!
-Nancy Sloane, Boulder, Colorado

reviews.title: Wonderful way to see Toronto!
text: Jane was fantastic - for starts, we booked through AnyRoad.com which was easy and (finally) let me pay for the tour with credit card. We went for a pre-wedding tour with much of our family. She and her partner were knowledgable and engaging about Toronto's history, architecture (which I love!), cultural nuances and fun stories. The tour was well organized and let us see a part of the city that even many of my Toronto relatives have not seen.
I didn't have a ton of time in Toronto, and On The Town was the most awesome way I could have imagined seeing the most interesting sites of the city.

reviews.title: Great way to get to know our own city
text: This past weekend we had the opportunity to take the Cultural Renaissance Walking with Jane and had a fantastic experience spending 1.5 hours getting to know our very own city.

Jane was incredibly knowledgable about the many architectural highlights of our city, telling is great stories about its history, the people at the center of the building's story, the architects involved and how it's evolved to what it is today.

Starting from the Gooderham Home at Bloor and St. George, we slowly made our way across Bloor with highlights at the Bata Museum, Munks School of Global Affairs, the Royal Conservatory, ROM, and Philosopher's Walk before heading down into the heart of the University of Toronto Campus.
It was quite the enlightening tour and enjoyed it vey much.  It's not every day that you get to roam around the city and learn about the history of what came to pass to create Toronto.

Jane is also super accommodating in terms of time arrangements which I appreciated.  Unlike a lot of the big regularly schedule tours that happen in the city, On the Town tours had a nice personal touch to it thanks to Jane.
